task.title: Reattach The Drawband
task.shortdesc: You can reattach a typewriter drawband by building tension in the mainspring barrel and inserting the drawband into the barrel slot.

step.cmd: Slide the typewriter carriage to the right hand side.

step.note: Ensure that the end of the drawband is still knotted or has a hooked end.
step.cmd: Locate the end of the drawband.

step.note: Three to four full rotations should suffice.
step.cmd: Build tension in the mainspring by rotating the mainspring barrel towards the right side of the carriage.
Locate the drawband hole and drawband slot in the mainspring barrel.
Insert the end of the drawband into the drawband hole.
Slide the drawband into the thin barrel slot.

step.note: Releasing the mainspring barrel too quickly could snap or loosen the drawband.
step.cmd: Release the mainspring barrel slowly while holding the drawband parallel to the barrel until tension in the barrel is fully released.

step.note: If there is slack in the drawband, the mainspring barrel did not have enough tension when inserting the drawband. Remove the drawband and try again.
step.cmd: Visually inspect the drawband to check for adequate tension.
